titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)
Chapter 65 – Hastening the doing of the good
Chapter 65 – Hastening the doing of the good

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ النُّعْمَانِ قَالَ حَدَّثَنِي حَمْزَةُ بْنُ حُمْرَانَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِذَا هَمَّ أَحَدُكُمْ بِخَيْرٍ فَلَا يُؤَخِّرْهُ فَإِنَّ الْعَبْدَ رُبَّمَا صَلَّى الصَّلَاةَ أَوْ صَامَ الْيَوْمَ فَيُقَالُ لَهُ اعْمَلْ مَا شِئْتَ بَعْدَهَا فَقَدْ غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ali Bin Al Numan who said, ‘Hamza Bin Humran narrated to me saying, ‘I heard Abu Abdullahasws saying: ‘Whenever one of you intends the goodness, so he should not delay it, for the servant sometimes prays the Salāt or Fasts for the day, and it is said to him: ‘Do whatever you so desire to after it, for Allahazwj has Forgiven (your sins) for you’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي جَمِيلَةَ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) افْتَتِحُوا نَهَارَكُمْ بِخَيْرٍ وَ أَمْلُوا عَلَى حَفَظَتِكُمْ فِي أَوَّلِهِ خَيْراً وَ فِي آخِرِهِ خَيْراً يُغْفَرْ لَكُمْ مَا بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Abu Jameela who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> said: ‘Begin your days with goodness, and dictate upon your preservers (Two recording Angels), goodness at the beginning of the day, and goodness at the end of it, He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> would Forgive (your sins) for you in what is between that, Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Willing’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُرَازِمِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ كَانَ أَبِي يَقُولُ إِذَا هَمَمْتَ بِخَيْرٍ فَبَادِرْ فَإِنَّكَ لَا تَدْرِي مَا يَحْدُثُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Murazim Bin Hakeym, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘My<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘Whenever you are intending with a goodness, so hasten, for you do not know what might occur’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ مِنَ الْخَيْرِ مَا يُعَجَّلُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Ibn Azina, from Zurara, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Loves from the goodness what is hastened (with)’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ بَشِيرِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا أَرَدْتَ شَيْئاً مِنَ الْخَيْرِ فَلَا تُؤَخِّرْهُ فَإِنَّ الْعَبْدَ يَصُومُ الْيَوْمَ الْحَارَّ يُرِيدُ مَا عِنْدَ اللَّهِ فَيُعْتِقُهُ اللَّهُ بِهِ مِنَ النَّارِ وَ لَا تَسْتَقِلَّ مَا يُتَقَرَّبُ بِهِ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ لَوْ شِقَّ تَمْرَةٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Aban Bin Usman, from Bashir, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Whenever you intend something from the goodness, so do not delay it, for the servant would Fast on the hot day intending what is in the Presence of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, so Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Free him from the Fire due to it, and you should not belittle what you could get closer with to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic, and even though it may be part of a date’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ هَمَّ بِخَيْرٍ فَلْيُعَجِّلْهُ وَ لَا يُؤَخِّرْهُ فَإِنَّ الْعَبْدَ رُبَّمَا عَمِلَ الْعَمَلَ فَيَقُولُ اللَّهُ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى قَدْ غَفَرْتُ لَكَ وَ لَا أَكْتُبُ عَلَيْكَ شَيْئاً أَبَداً وَ مَنْ هَمَّ بِسَيِّئَةٍ فَلَا يَعْمَلْهَا فَإِنَّهُ رُبَّمَا عَمِلَ الْعَبْدُ السَّيِّئَةَ فَيَرَاهُ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ فَيَقُولُ لَا وَ عِزَّتِي وَ جَلَالِي لَا أَغْفِرُ لَكَ بَعْدَهَا أَبَداً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Ibn Fazzal, from Ibn Bukeyr, from one of his companions, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who intends a goodness, so let him hasten it and not delay it, for sometimes the servant performs the deed, so Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Blessed and High is Saying: “I<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> have Forgiven (your sins) for you and will not Write anything against you, ever!”; and the one who intends an evil, so he should not hasten it, for sometimes the servant would perform the evil, so Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>, Glorious is He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup>, Sees him, and He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> is Saying: “No, by My<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Honour and My<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Majesty, I<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> will not Forgive (your sins) for you after it, ever!”’.

verses.text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا هَمَمْتَ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ مِنَ الْخَيْرِ فَلَا تُؤَخِّرْهُ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ رُبَّمَا اطَّلَعَ عَلَى الْعَبْدِ وَ هُوَ عَلَى شَيْ‏ءٍ مِنَ الطَّاعَةِ فَيَقُولُ وَ عِزَّتِي وَ جَلَالِي لَا أُعَذِّبُكَ بَعْدَهَا أَبَداً وَ إِذَا هَمَمْتَ بِسَيِّئَةٍ فَلَا تَعْمَلْهَا فَإِنَّهُ رُبَّمَا اطَّلَعَ اللَّهُ عَلَى الْعَبْدِ وَ هُوَ عَلَى شَيْ‏ءٍ مِنَ الْمَعْصِيَةِ فَيَقُولُ وَ عِزَّتِي وَ جَلَالِي لَا أَغْفِرُ لَكَ بَعْدَهَا أَبَداً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Salim, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> having said: ‘Whenever you intend for anything from the goodness, so do not delay it, for Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic would Notify upon the servant while he is upon something from the obedience, so He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> is Saying: ‘By My<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Honour and My<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Majesty! I<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> will not Punish you after it, ever!” And when he intends for an evil, but he does not do it, so sometimes Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> would Notify upon the servant while he is upon something from the disobedience, so He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> is Saying: “By My<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Honour and My <sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Majesty! I<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> will not Forgive (your sins) for you after it, ever!”’.

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَمِيلَةَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حُمْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا هَمَّ أَحَدُكُمْ بِخَيْرٍ أَوْ صِلَةٍ فَإِنَّ عَنْ يَمِينِهِ وَ شِمَالِهِ شَيْطَانَيْنِ فَلْيُبَادِرْ لَا يَكُفَّاهُ عَنْ ذَلِكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Ibn Fazzal, from Abu Jameela, from Muhammad Bin Humran, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Whenever one of you intends a goodness, or a maintenance of relationship, so upon his right and upon his left would be Satans<sup>la</sup>, therefore, let him hasten and not refrain from that’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْجَارُودِ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ مَنْ هَمَّ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ مِنَ الْخَيْرِ فَلْيُعَجِّلْهُ فَإِنَّ كُلَّ شَيْ‏ءٍ فِيهِ تَأْخِيرٌ فَإِنَّ لِلشَّيْطَانِ فِيهِ نَظْرَةً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Abu Al Jaroud who said, 
‘I heard Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The one who intends for formatting from the goodness, so let him hasten it, for in everything where is a delay, so for the Satans<sup>la</sup> therein is a respite’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنِ الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ ثَقَّلَ الْخَيْرَ عَلَى أَهْلِ الدُّنْيَا كَثِقْلِهِ فِي مَوَازِينِهِمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ خَفَّفَ الشَّرَّ عَلَى أَهْلِ الدُّنْيَا كَخِفَّتِهِ فِي مَوَازِينِهِمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Ali Bin Asbaat, from Al A’ala, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said, 
‘I heard Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Weighs down the goodness upon the people of the world like its weighing down would be in their Scales on the Day of Judgement; and Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Lightens the evil upon the people of the world like its lightness would be in their Scales on the Day of Judgement’.
